title: Police investigating after piece of a pig turns up in Newton park
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A pig leg or flank was discovered near Flowed Meadow at the Cove in Auburndale Park, Newton.
Police found a red flag and note beside the pig meat; the reason for its placement remains unclear.
Newton Animal Control and Mass. Environmental Police are investigating the incident under Massachusetts General Law restrictions.

title: Jaylen Brown, Payton Pritchard dominate in blowout win over Lakers: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Jaylen Brown scored a game-high 32 points despite a 10-for-28 shooting performance in a win against the Lakers.
Payton Pritchard delivered 30 points off the bench, continuing his strong scoring streak for the Celtics.
LeBron James praised Jaylen Brown post-game, affirming a respectful relationship despite previous comments on social media.

title: These Mass. schools are closed on Monday, Feb. 23
author: Audrey Cooney
bullets: Dozens of Massachusetts school districts are closed on Feb. 23 due to a major snow storm.
Schools with closures include Boston, Cambridge, Worcester, and many others across the region.
Residents are encouraged to check for updates and report any unlisted closures via email.

title: Fall River police searching for man accused of shooting, killing dog
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Kyron Simmons, 36, is accused of shooting and killing a dog at Sunset Hill Housing Development, Fall River.
Simmons faces charges including home invasion, firearm offenses, and reckless endangerment of a child.
Fall River police have issued an arrest warrant and say Simmons is considered armed and dangerous.

title: Greater Boston town issues guidance after bobcat sighting
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Bobcat sighting reported near Deerpath Road and Route 109 in Dedham, according to animal control officers on Facebook.
Dedham Animal Control advises residents on wildlife safety as bobcat mating season increases activity and visibility.
Residents encouraged to seal entry points, supervise pets, and report sick or aggressive wildlife to animal control.

title: Alex Cora gives an early preview of Red Sox 2026 lineup
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Cora previews Boston Red Sox's likely 2026 Opening Day lineup during a spring training game against the Blue Jays.
Roman Anthony is set to lead off, followed by Trevor Story in the second spot, as per Cora's lineup plans.
Isiah Kiner-Falefa included in the lineup over Marcelo Mayer, despite Mayer's prospect status and infield training.

title: Live updates: What to know about the nor’easter hitting Massachusetts
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Up to 24 inches of snow and high winds predicted for Massachusetts, causing concerns about power outages and road safety.
Boston declares snow emergency; public schools closed, MBTA schedules reduced, ferries suspended amid severe weather.
DoorDash and Grubhub halt delivery services in Boston due to safety concerns from the nor’easter impact.

title: Bruins react to McAvoy, Swayman’s gold-medal win over Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Charlie McAvoy and Jeremy Swayman helped Team USA win gold in hockey, ending a 46-year drought.
McAvoy recorded significant ice time and made key plays, crucially stopping a potential Canada goal in the final.
Bruins teammates celebrated the victory at Warrior Ice Arena, with a national anthem salute for McAvoy and Swayman.

title: 2026 NFL Mock Draft roundup: 7 names for Patriots fans to know entering combine week
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots hold the No. 31 pick in the 2026 NFL Draft, focusing on offensive linemen and edge rushers.
Draft prospects for the Patriots include Zion Young, EDGE, Missouri, and Max Iheanachor, OT, Arizona State.
Kenyon Sadiq, TE, Oregon, also considered due to his pass-catching ability, though tight end isn't a pressing need.

title: Team USA writes a new chapter and other takeaways from gold-medal triumph over Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Team USA men's hockey won Olympic gold for the first time since 1980, beating Canada 2-1 in overtime.
Jack Hughes scored the winning goal in 3-on-3 overtime, securing victory for the U.S. in Milan, Italy.
Connor Hellebuyck had a standout performance, stopping 41 shots and leading the U.S. to a historic win.
